info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 30 at 6:33AM CDT until June 30 at 6:01PM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
...The National Weather Service in Springfield MO has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Missouri...
Jacks Fork at Alley Spring affecting Shannon County.
For the Jacks Fork River...including Alley Spring...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Jacks Fork at Alley Spring.
* WHEN...From this morning to this evening.
* IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, water impacts Alley Spring Campground. Water is one foot in depth at the 600, 800 and 900 loop camp sites.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:30 AM CDT Monday the stage was 8.8 feet. - Bankfull stage is 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.5 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.6 feet on 04/28/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
The next statement will be issued this evening at 615 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO THIS EVENING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY
